“The parameter w represents the asymmetry in the utility function between losses and rewards … designed to capture the tendency of decision makers to allow losses to have a greater influence on their evaluation.”
“The relative influence of these two factors … are modulated by the learning rate parameter a. A higher value for this parameter means that the most recent outcome will be more highly weighted.”

measured_by: response-consistency parameter c (or θ) of the PVL-Delta soft-max choice rule
justification: “The rule incorporates a sensitivity parameter θ, which is a re-parameterization of a response consistency parameter c … Agents with a lower consistency parameter will tend more to explore choice options.”
